alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 10:58AM EDT until May 01 at 8:37AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond and Henrico. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 AM EDT, VDOT reported flooding on Route 651 in northern Chesterfield County. While the heaviest rain has ended, the threat for flooding will continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, University Of Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Bon Air, Virginia Union University, Tuckahoe, Mechanicsville, Chester, Lakeside, Laurel, Bensley, East Highland Park, Glen Allen, Bellwood, Chesterfield Court House, Wyndham, Roslyn Hills, Dumbarton and Greendale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
